Name: wrapAll
Desc: Wraps all nodes together in a single wrapper element.
LongDesc: Wraps all matched elements as a single group within an HTML structure. This method is useful for inserting a new parent structure around a set of elements without disrupting their existing document position. Unlike 'wrap', which wraps each element individually, 'wrapAll' places all elements within a single container, making it ideal for grouping related elements together for styling or JavaScript manipulation.
Example:
Q('.item').wrapAll('
'); // Wrap all .item in a div
Q('.items').wrapAll('<section id="container"></section>'); // Wrap in a section
const wrapperElement = document.createElement('div'); Q('.related-posts').wrapAll(wrapperElement); // Wrap with element

Q('.deep').wrapAll('
'); // Deeply nested wrapper
